intro: Allophylus timboensis, commonly known as the Timboense Allophylus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Sarcolaenaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. Allophylus timboensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
